ca.etsmtl.log430.lab1
Class ResourceReader

java.lang.Object
  ca.etsmtl.log430.lab1.LineOfTextFileReader
      ca.etsmtl.log430.lab1.ResourceReader

public class ResourceReader
extends LineOfTextFileReader

Reads from the InputFile and instantiates the Resource objects in the system. It is assumed that the InputFile is in the local directory, contains the active resources, and each line of input is read and expected in the following format: a field oriented and space-separated text file that lists all the resources. The fields are as follows: 

     R001 Bleau Joseph ANA P001 P003 
     |    |     |      |   |
     |    |     |      |   Projects to which this resource is allocated (id)
     |    |     |      Role (ANA=Analyst, DES=Designer, PRG=programmer,
     |    |     |            TST=tester)
     |    |     Resource's First Name
     |    Resource's Last Name 
     Resource ID
The resources.txt file has been provided as an example.

Version:
1.7, 2013-Sep-13
Author:
A.J. Lattanze, CMU

Method Detail

readResourceListFromFile

public ResourceList readResourceListFromFile(java.lang.String inputFile)
Reads a line of text. The line of text is passed to the parseText method where it is parsed and a Resource object is returned. The Resource object is then added to the list. When a null is read from the Resource file the method terminates and returns the list to the caller. A list that points to null is an empty list.

Parameters:
inputFile -
Returns:
The list of drivers

Parse lines of text that are read from the text file containing driver information in the above format.
